qas.question: Which month is the first in the year Parliament takes a two week vacation?
Where do plenary meetings take place?
Who are debates and meetings open to?
How much does it cost to gain entry to a parliament meeting?
What contains a nearly verbatim of parliamentary debates?
What typically sits Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Fridays?
Parliament typically sits from February to late what?
Plenary meetings in the debating chamber usually take place on Tuesday afternoons from 1pm to what?
What meetings are closed to the public?
What debates are closed to the public?

context: <b5_0>Parliament<b5_0/> typically sits Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays from early January to late <b6_0>June<b6_0/> and from early September to mid December, with two-week recesses in <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>April<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> and October. Plenary meetings in the <a1_0><a1_1>debating chamber<a1_1/><a1_0/> usually take place on <a1_2>Wednesday afternoons<a1_2/> from 2 pm to <b7_0>6 pm<b7_0/> and on Thursdays from 9:15 am to 6 pm. <b9_0>Chamber<b9_0/> debates and <b8_0>committee<b8_0/> meetings are open to <a2_0><a2_1>the <a2_2>public<a2_2/><a2_0/>.<a2_1/> Entry is <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>free<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, but booking in advance is recommended due to limited space. Meetings are broadcast on the Parliament's own channel Holyrood.tv and on the BBC's parliamentary channel BBC Parliament. Proceedings are also recorded in text form, in print and online, in <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>the Official Report<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>, which is the substantially verbatim transcript of parliamentary debates.
